paper.title: A Model Elimination Calculus with Built-in Theories
paper.venue: GWAI '92 Proceedings of the 16th German Conference on Artificial Intelligence: Advances in Artificial Intelligence
paper.abstract: The model elimination calculus is a linear, refulationally complete calculus for first order clause logic. We show how to extend this calculus with a framework for theory reasoning. Theory reasoning means to separate the knowledge of a given domain or theory and treat it by special purpose inference rules. We present two versions of theory model elimination: the one is called total theory model elimination (which allows e.g. to treat equality in a rigid E-resolution style), and the other is called partial theory model elimination (which allows e.g. to treat equality in a paramodulation style).
